channel.title: Which game is more worth he money?
channel.description:
I wanted to started this thread to ask my quesion, and mayby other people can ask theirs.
Which one should I get Counter strike source or the original counter-strike?

item.title: Which game is more worth he money?
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Get Bad Company 2 instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Which game is more worth he money?
item.dc:creator: Defender
item.description:
If you buy CS: S in the store, the box comes with Day of Defeat: Source as well. Definitely well worth the money, since DoD is one of the most overlooked games ever and it ROCKS!

item.source: Which game is more worth he money?

item.title: Which game is more worth he money?
item.dc:creator: James.Curse
item.description:
CS: S is exactly the same to CS. Only with better graphics and in a newer engine (source).
Definitely worth your money, when I got it, it was on offer (10 bucks) but still I think it’s worth 20 dollars. There are lots of mods out there (zombie mod being my favourite) and you will find your self coming back again and again to the game for a quick match.

If you aren’t convinced other games I recommend you are Team Fortress 2 or call of duty 4 (not modern warfare 2).

Read full topic
item.source: Which game is more worth he money?

item.title: Which game is more worth he money?
item.dc:creator: The_Minotaur
item.description:
Jingles:

If you have Gmod, then get CS: S as lots of props and textures from it are used.

I think most of them you get anyway.

But in my opinion CS: S is the one to get. CS was good, but is a bit old now. I played it the other day, and realised how dated it felt.

Anyway, CS taught me how to play FPS so it deserves credit.

Read full topic
item.source: Which game is more worth he money?

item.title: Which game is more worth he money?
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
Neither game is worth the money EVER. They’re both boring-ass games with some of the world’s most insufferable players.

Then again, maybe the OP hates fun, variety, and good company.

Read full topic
